content.description: Getting off the ground is the crux.  Balance your way straight up the face crimping, pinching, and edging small nubbins.  Avoid using the arete.
content.location: The blank face between First Overhang and the hip-high boulder.

content.description:
Another classic of the Gate Boulders, revolving around a small crimp and a big move.  Like Barfly, it's mostly a one move wonder, though I found it to be a little bit tougher.  Either way both problems compliment each other well as they are similar styles.

Start on the crescent shaped crimp to the right of Standard Overhang.  Move up and right to a small crimp and jump to jug straight above.  The big gaston to the left is off.
Start on the  left side of the boulder on the undercling and a sidepull at mid-height.  Move right and up.
Lip traverse the west face of the Fly Boulder.  Turn the corner and finish as for Standard Overhang.  Classic.
content.protection: A moving crashpad would be ideal.

content.description: Start on Barfly end on Superfly
content.location: Start on Barfly end on Superfly

content.description: Start on Barfly, end on Crystal Pinch
content.location: Start on Barfly, end on Crystal Pinch

content.description:
Start on the obvious crescent shaped hold near the center of the overhang with both hands, which is also the start of Superfly.  Make a big move up and left up to the gaston, then either top out straight up, or top out a bit right on the Superfly jug.

This problem seems almost like an eliminate until you pull onto the starting hold and realize moving up and left is far easier than going right to the Superfly crimp.  A nice variant.

Not to be confused with Iron Cross, which goes right to the Superfly crimp first, then left to the gaston, and shares the same finish.

From BB: Mantle up the groove right of Barfly left of the tree.

V4 Variation: Low start on edges

V5 Variation: Start here and traverse left to the top of Superfly
From BB: Up the mantle to the right of the tree

Classic Mike Beck (MB) traverse that opened up in about 2014-2015 when one of the trees moved, allowing for an extended traverse in from the right.  Has gotten a little harder after the 2016 vandalism made the Barfly jug worse.  Start standing all the way around right on the big sidepull jug. Climb left on the low part of the slab. Wrap around the corner and continue left along the slopey surfboard feature, perhaps using a cool undercling. Then drop into the classic left leaning ramp and Barfly holds to the Superfly jug. Rest, then drop down onto the Standard Overhang moves. Wrap left past Crystal Pinch to the chickenhead jug. Then tick tack and fight the pump to finish on the Pump Traverse backwards. At the start of the Pump Traverse, throw your left foot up and top out.  Video available

here

.  To MB's knowledge, this traverse has not yet been climbed from left to right.

I find traverses--and stamina climbing generally--rather hard to grade. Recognizing that, I propose a route/traverse grade of 5.13+/V10 Traverse--MB has suggested around 5.13b/c.  I welcome other's thoughts.
content.protection: Numerous pads are helpful to make this feel safe.
content.location: Start on the right side of the east face of the Standard Overhang Boulder.  End at the start of the Pump Traverse on the west face.

content.description: Up the middle of the east facing wall.  Traverse right into the overhang.

Traverse the slopey lip of the Fly Boulder from right to left.

Topping out on the Barfly crystal makes the route about v4,

Continuing to the Superfly jug through bad slopers will bump the grade up to v5.

Super good movement as you lie back and heel hook your way to the top.
content.protection: a couple crash pads and spotters
content.location:
On the south face of the Fly Boulder.

Start on the far right side of the boulder next to the tree, traverse the lip going left.

content.description: Start matched on the left hand hold of standard overhang move left onto the pinch then dyno up to the chicken head jug.
content.location: Just left of standard overhang V3.

content.description: Two starting holds, one undercling right, and small undercling pocket for the left. Sit start makes the grade. Do it sitting on the ground for full effect. Go up and left to a crimp rail, then slightly right is a slanted jug. Next, to slopers to the right of that and up to a crystal to the top out.
content.location: Located at the middle of the Standard Overhang boulder.

content.description: Start on Barfly end right of Superfly (grab the sharp crimp with the LH)
content.location: Start on Barfly end right of Superfly
